aabe209b-c051-4250-8cd0-73b2f4f5ca1c IAEA assesses long-term safety at ForsmarkAn International Atomic Energy Agency team of experts has completed a Safety Aspects of Long-Term Operation mission to units 1 and 2 of the Forsmark nuclear power plant in Sweden, which operator Vattenfall plans to operate for 60 years. Mon, 20 Nov 2023 15:26:04 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/IAEA-assesses-long-term-safety-at-Forsmark?feed=feed
04066b8b-b4a6-431a-b8cd-186deeb0c455 Koeberg 1 back online after milestone outageThe pressurised water reactor was synchronised to the South African energy grid on 18 November after nearly a year offline for the replacement of the plant's three original steam generators, a prerequisite for the long-term operation of the plant. Mon, 20 Nov 2023 15:12:16 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Koeberg-1-back-online-after-milestone-outage?feed=feed
401deaad-3586-4445-b344-d5454fe57359 Installation of El Dabaa 2's core catcher beginsA ceremony has been held to mark the beginning of the installation - ahead of schedule - of the core catcher in the second unit at Egypt's El Dabaa nuclear power plant. Mon, 20 Nov 2023 14:56:20 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Installation-of-El-Dabaa-2-s-core-catcher-begins?feed=feed
e31a31da-01cd-4268-a21f-bab8239a64e8 Eiffage awarded civil engineering contract for Penly EPR2sFrench construction company Eiffage, through its subsidiary Eiffage Génie Civil, has been awarded a contract worth more than EUR4 billion (USD4.4 billion) by EDF for civil engineering works on the first two EPR2 reactors planned at the Penly site in Normandy, northern France. Mon, 20 Nov 2023 12:59:59 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Eiffage-awarded-civil-engineering-contract-for-Pen?feed=feed
073e4ea5-a6c4-4edd-b4f3-1ee71f51e2f3 Framatome piping rehabilitation system an industry 'first'A two-year test programme has validated the first spray-in-place structural liner system for use within nuclear plant safety-related applications for long-term plant operations and licence renewals. Fri, 17 Nov 2023 15:45:42 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Framatome-piping-rehabilitation-system-an-industry?feed=feed
1a759cc7-ae60-4a75-9d8c-6db732ac7abfSweden plans 'massive' expansion of nuclear energyThe Swedish government unveils a roadmap which envisages the construction of new nuclear generating capacity equivalent to at least two large-scale reactors by 2035, with up to ten new large-scale reactors coming online by 2045. Fri, 17 Nov 2023 12:00:40 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Roadmap-launched-for-expansion-of-nuclear-energy-i?feed=feed
4b53116a-10a3-49b0-985b-57ee45aea175 Studsvik, Fortum study prospects for new nuclear at NyköpingSwedish nuclear technical services provider Studsvik has signed a memorandum of understanding with Finnish utility Fortum to explore the conditions for new nuclear at the Studsvik industrial site near Nyköping in Sweden. Fri, 17 Nov 2023 14:30:00 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Studsvik,-Fortum-study-prospects-for-new-nuclear-a?feed=feed
60241fd4-6605-4f0f-bc0c-b6d06abaf115 Fourth Barakah unit receives operating licenceThe United Arab Emirates' nuclear regulator has issued the licence to Nawah Energy Company, clearing the way for commissioning and commercial operation of the unit and marking a historic moment as the UAE realises its nuclear energy vision. Fri, 17 Nov 2023 13:08:08 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Fourth-Barakah-unit-receives-operating-licence?feed=feed
fca5e1bc-f2d6-429a-a730-45bf7ab0e990 Nuclear accord signed between USA and PhilippinesThe USA and the Philippines have signed a civil nuclear cooperation agreement - known as a 123 Agreement - that will allow the transfer of nuclear energy-related materials and components between the two countries. Fri, 17 Nov 2023 15:29:44 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Nuclear-accord-signed-between-USA-and-Philippines?feed=feed
23aa8986-0a1e-4cec-a110-49d864b548f3 UK 'should emulate South Korea' on new nuclearThe All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nuclear Energy report, <i> 《英国制造：核复兴之路》表示，应该订购多个小型模块化反应堆装置，以证明公司对英国生产设施的投资是合理的，并呼吁明年支持北威尔士的威尔法作为下一个大规模反应堆植物。 ; Fri, 17 Nov 2023 09:56:38 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/UK-should-emulate-France-and-South-Korea-on-new-nu?feed=feed
6cd3f55d-f340-4b96-8d36-315a2fe9fbee Work on Xudabao unit 1 gets under wayConstruction has started of the nuclear island for unit 1 at the Xudabao nuclear power plant in Liaoning Province, China National Nuclear Corporation announced.
